page.title: 20EVENTS
page.content: EVENTS. In the Surrey Best Kept Village Competition Churt did well to gain 3rd place in the medium villages section The churchyard and small garden of remembrance were considered to be excellent,other areas of the village were said to be very good.The village hall,apart from some blocked soakaways and a few weeds,was highly commended.A voucher for a tree provided by the Men of the Trees will mark the 1985 efforts of the village.The school was commended for the playground area which was judged to be kept tidy and attractive. Churt cricket club retained the Miller cup which they won last year. The Anaconda,a rare musical instrument was played by Mr, Christopher Monk of Churt for members of the Royal Family at Hampton Court Palace.
